I've put them through abuse. Trail running, waterparks, worked in them. I've work the sole down thin and the price is so reachable. I do IT and I'll wear these to work on occasion. 评论概述: My first pair of minimal shoes
评论详情: If you're curious and can afford the shoes, buy these and just try them. I've worn "normal" shoes (mostly heavy boots...) for all of my adult life, and these have made me venture down the minimal shoe rabbit hole. They're extremely comfortable, flexible, and you can feel every bit/detail of what you're walking over. I'm a musician and standing for a 2-4 hour performance in my normal footware has started to cause me pain and fatigue. These shoes have solved that issue.  I only detract one star for the material within the heel of the shoe. It seems to be of a very thin and brittle material, and it has turned into a weird "crumpled ball of paper" inside of the heel's fabric type of feeling. I don't know how else to explain that. They would be perfect for how they're advertised/described if this could be fixed. I will buy these again if needed so it is really a non-issue, I'm just being picky. And for the price, beggars can't be choosers.
Fantastic shoe at a great price. Wear them casually and you won’t be disappointed. Fit great
Great barefoot shoes.  Have had for awhile and used extensively.  Great for everyday wear and durable enough to take it.  I've still not worn down the soles after almost a year.
These are wide enough, comfortable and ver light I enjoy wearing them
very comfortable. really loud squeak on lino, wood or tile.
This shoe checks the boxes to qualify as a shoe, that is all it's aiming to do 'be there'. If you want more out of a shoe this not the shoe for you.
Overall for the price I love these shoes. Very comfy and a bit thicker than my zero shoes making them nicer for everyday use. I’m definitely getting a few more.

I am giving this product 5 stars because of the price I got these shoes. They are very comfortable to wear daily. But the quality of the shoe is questionably. I guess it is going to be useful for few months
Helps keep my shoe from wearing on one side after only a short time causing ankle pain. Will likely buy again.

Comfortable starter shoe if you are wanting to go barefoot. These shoes are budget friend and perform like the higher priced barefoot shoes. Good for working out or all day wear.

I can’t believe they have lasted as long as they have. I will definitely be buying more pairs. They fit great and look good. I’ve had several people ask where to get them. I followed the sizing suggestions and they were spot on for me.

My husband is a huge fan of barefoot style shoes.  He usually bought Merrell's but they keep adjusting their designs and now the fit isn't as good (not to mention the cost).  We tried Whitin brand since they were affordable enough, in case he didn't love them.  He's purchased 3 more colors since trying them!!

I'm writing this review after 1 day of wearing these. So I may post updates if things change.  What I like:  I like that the toebox is shaped like an actual human foot. I like having space to splay and wiggle my toes and these shoes offer that. I like how minimal they are. They feel like I'm wearing nothing.  What I don't like:  I knew what I was signing up for when I bought these, but I don't like the "zero drop" aspect of these shoes. Interestingly enough, the insoles in these shoes seem to be more of a "negative drop" than "zero drop." The thickness of the insole at the heel feels thinner than at the toes when I take it out and give it the "very precise and scientific" finger pinch test. After a day of wearing them with the stock insoles I went to Walmart and bought some Dr. Scholl's cut-to-fit gel insoles that provide a tiny bit of heel raise to them. That modification made these shoes quite a bit more comfortable if you're not a fan of the zero drop aspect. It also gave the general experience of walking around a bit more cushion. I know...I'm defeating the purpose of "barefoot" style shoes by adding heel lift and cushion. Check the pictures to see which Dr. Scholl's insole I got.  My only other "complaint" about these shoes is that the soles are kind of loud and tappy sounding when my toes land on the ground. Hopefully that goes away over time.

Its bottom and insole are not as thin as vivo, and it's stiffer, so I can't feel the ground much. But I get what I paid for, and I would consider buying another pair soon.

I really like these do NOT have some stupid word printed across them like "SPORTS" or some other non-sense from the chinese manufacturers. If you're looking for simple and and plain, this is your shoe.

I ordered a pair of these shoes on Monday and was really excited. I bought my first pair of wide barefoot shoes half a year ago, and my feet feel better than ever. I received these shoes on Wednesday, and to my disappointment, the left shoe had two spots that rubbed my foot wrong. I took them off—no pain. I put on other pairs of shoes I own—no pain. I wore them around the house, wondering if they’d wear in, but no luck. I figured I must have gotten a defective pair, so I ordered another pair thinking I’d send one pair back. Nope. The second pair was the same as the first. The shoe is slightly narrower and something inside just makes my foot hurt.  I’m really bummed these didn’t work out. They look like they’re decently made. I’m returning both pairs and going to try a different model. Really hoping I have better results. I’ve never run into this issue before.

Love these shoes for the price. They fit well, they were comfortable out of the box and they performed for what I wanted them for, which was a barefoot-style shoe for my morning walks. Only note I will make is that if you choose white, the upper is fabric and will stain if not treated or cleaned.

I feel guilty leaving such a negative review because I am probably uneducated on the science if minimal shoes. But, these sneakers feel more like water shoes than sneakers, they are very light, comfortable fit and true to size. The only negative, which is a big one for me is that there is not much sole support. Like I said it could be the structure of "minimal" shoes to reduce sole support but for high impact movements like running or long distance walking, for me it's a bit uncomfortable.
They are good for the price, but not really all day shoes. I've worn Vivo, Lems, and all sorts of other barefoot shoes, and I prefer to pay the extra price.

I bought these men's shoes though I am woman because I liked the color combo. Super roomy and comfy with room to spread my toes. I like how you feel close to the earth - almost a barefoot feel. Great travel shoes since they are so light weight and great for walking.

I have bought three pairs of these shoes. And while I was disappointed that I would wear a hole into the soles in 4 months with my first two sets, I was happy with the fit.  But I didn't think that I would have this much wear after only 20 DAYS. That's all it took to wear down the tread with less than 5000 steps a day.  I am returning these shoes and never buying from this company again.

Purchased a second pair after wearing the first a few days.  I also have some Xero shoes.  These have just as wide of a toe box but there is an insole that does have a slight drop.  Overall for more than half the money less it is well worth it.
You might need to change your walking gait to a traditional barefoot gait (toe to heel) in order to avoid an audible slap from the metatarsal (front of foot)
Low shoes

评论概述: No longer wide fit, nor wide toe box
评论详情: The original Whitin sneakers I got were wide toe box and wide fit. The build quality was cheap, so I'm glad that this version is a lot better in material and quality. Unfortunately they are no longer wide toe box. My toes are scrunched on the sides in this pair even though I even ordered one size up.

I ordered these because they were listed as wide.  Some reviewers have mentioned size consistency QC issues.  One reviewer mentioned ordering 3 pairs and having the size between the 3 pairs vary 0.25 in/6.35mm in length  I decided to take a chance based on the overall reviews and most people saying they ran large or to size.  I have wide feet and numerous individuals have mentioned that these wide shoes were truly a wide size.  I ordered 13W and what arrived were labeled 13W yet were really a 12M.  Notice in the photo my thumb is touching my toe at the very end of the shoe.  Also these are noticably narrower than my size 13 Xero Scramblers which are not wide by barefoot shoe standards and are a bit snug for me.  Overall they seem to be made in a decent manner.  Yet,  having the actual size be so far off from what is labeled is just not acceptable.  These will be sent back.

评论概述: Not bad, especially for the price
评论详情: For the price, these are a great introduction to minimalist shoes and a worthy replacement for my old go-to's, the Saucony Bullets.  Pros: -Price. These cost less than half as much as most other pairs of minimalist shoes. -Upper material They are soft and breath well. No heel chafing at all.  Cons: -Narrow toe-box for minimalist shoes. The toeibox here is a bit pinched, which exacerbates the next issue. -Stitching hot-spot on the pinkie toes. This isn't entirely unexpected. My pinkie toe falls at a spot where there needs to be reinforced stitching. But in a shoe where the materials are otherwise nice and soft and plush, the stitching rubbing here is a bummer. That said, nothing that can't be overcome with a bit of moleskin. And at this pricepoint, it's not bad.  Overall, especially if you intend to wear socks and have never tried a minimalist or barefoot shoe, these are a solid first shot without breaking the bank. Give them a shot and see what you think.
Good

评论概述: European size conversion is NOT accurate
评论详情: The size conversion on these shoes is terrible. I normally wear a 10-10.5 US size shoe. When I placed the order for these, the product page specifically says these shoes “run large” which I’ve heard in a real thing in doing my research on barefoot shoes.  I should have known better from shoes natively constructed in European sizing. These shoes do not run large by any American standard. The 9.5-10 shoes I received yesterday are too small for me to even get onto my feet. Ridiculous.

Didn’t even take both shoes out of the plastic bag (no box). They are poorly made. Cheap materials. Cheap looking. Size was off. Maybe it’s time we all quit buying this dubious import garbage. I’ve bought better shoes at a dollar store.
I require a large toe box and zero drop heel. These were perfect.

评论概述: cost effective and worthwhile introduction to a product that may change your life

I have been wanting to move into a more grounded feeling shoe. Overall, the design is good and feels great. Having a wider toe-box has been awesome so that your toes can stretch and flex. I did bump down a star for durability. Look, this is an inexpensive product so keep in mind the materials are not of highest quality.  Again, I am happy enough that I am buying a different style from this brand. It would be nice though to have a line available with more durable material. Cheers!

Shoe is true to size and fits the bill for a barefoot shoe. There's minimal height difference across the sole of the shoe with a wide toe box and a thin flexible outer sole. It takes some getting used to but I could feel my arches flexing when walking, and I naturally lightened my heel strike since there's no extra cushioning at the heel.
Did not fit well wrong size not much support. Will be returning.

I can wear these with casual clothes or even business casual. They are comfortable and so lightweight. For some reason the insoles in this brand’s shoes don’t stay put. I just take them out and they feel fine.

The consensus of reviews said to order a half size larger.  I usually wear 12 and I ordered 12 1/2.  They fit well.  These are very comfortable overall.  In high school 50 years ago, I had a pair of very light stripped down white canvas shoes that I liked, especially on hot summer days.  Since then, shoes have gone to more protection, support, and thicker tread which is fine when you need it.  When I read about minimalist shoes, I remembered the shoes I had in high school and decided to give them a try.  I'm glad I did.
Most comfortable pair of shoes I've ever worn to be honest, I'll keep buying them as long as they keep making them this good.
First pair of zero drop shoes. Fits great especially for the price.
